tame.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a tame animal or bird is not wild any longer, because it has been trained to live with people
tame.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Most of the criticism has been pretty tame.
I decided that teaching was too tame for me.
tame.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: used to describe a person who is willing to do what other people ask, even if it is slightly dishonest
tame.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: If you have a tame doctor, he might give you a sick note.
tame.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to reduce the power or strength of something and prevent it from causing trouble
tame.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The prime minister managed to tame the trade unions.
tame.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to train a wild animal to obey you and not to attack people
tame.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: The Asian elephant can be tamed and trained.
